utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And your horoscope says, "On the fifth a special someone is going to give you a gift."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, well thank you in advance.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Op, but the twelfth brings a lover’s spat.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You are going to make a joke about my special present! Why would you do that?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, wait and on the nineteenth a secret crush announces itself.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey guys!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! It’s Joey Tribbiani of Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.!!!!!!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh that’s right. It’s your first day! So are you psyched to fight fake crime with your robot sidekick?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Am I psyched? The lead in my own TV series? I’ve dreamed about this for years! Why have I not been preparing?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! Joey, you’re going to be great!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But I got to act with a robot Pheebs, and-and I don’t know anything about technology! I can’t even use Chandler’s computer except to find porn! And-and that’s only ‘cause it’s right there when you turn it on!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I think our lover’s spat will start a little early this month.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’ll be waiting.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are you judging them by their covers? Because you’re really not supposed to do that.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, I’m just deciding which one to use—I’m gonna start writing another book!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Be-because the last one was such a big seller?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, if you must know I have written 14 books. And as I am the only one who has read them, I can tell you that they all have been very well received.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What are you guys doing later?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, Rachel and I have appointments to get our hair cut.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We do?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I want to see what he wants first.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I just found out that Elizabeth’s dad wants to meet me.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wait a minute, hold the phone! You’re not Elizabeth’s dad?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on guys, I-I really want this guy to like me. It-it would really help me out if you guys were here to make me look good.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Of course we’ll help! Yeah! We’ll be here!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thanks!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We know how tough those parent/teacher conferences can be.

utterance.speaker: The Producer
utterance.content: So uh, here’s your office set!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow! Huh? Mac Macaveli, Private Investigator!

utterance.speaker: The Producer
utterance.content: Let’s get you into wardrobe for a fitting.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay. Hey uh, when do I get to meet the robot?

utterance.speaker: The Producer
utterance.content: I’m sorry, why don’t we do that right now? He’s right here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: The Producer
utterance.content: Joey Tribbiani, this is…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh wow! He’s so lifelike! Unbelievable! (He starts tugging on the guy’s ears.

utterance.speaker: The Producer
utterance.content: This is Wayne, the man who created and operates C.H.E.E.S.E.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How do you do there, Wayne?

utterance.speaker: The Producer
utterance.content: I’ll let you two guys get acquainted, huh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay. Sorry about that… Uh, so where’s C.H.E.E.S.E.?

utterance.speaker: Wayne
utterance.content: C.H.E.E.S.E. is right here.

utterance.speaker: C.H.E.E.S.E.
utterance.content: Nice to meet you Mac!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: This is like the temporary robot, right?

utterance.speaker: Wayne
utterance.content: No. Why?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, I-I just, I just it was going to be like a really cool robot, y’know? Like the terminator or uh, when I first saw you.

utterance.speaker: Wayne
utterance.content: I spent two years developing this machine, it’s absolutely state of the art.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m sorry, it just—I don’t know it doesn’t really look like it can do anything.

utterance.speaker: Wayne
utterance.content: It can do this.

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: This is my father, Paul Stevens. Dad, this is Ross Geller.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It-it’s great to meet you Paul.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: I usually prefer Elizabeth’s boyfriends to address me as Mr. Stevens.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Of course, of course, Mr. Stevens.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: So Ross, what your problem?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Eh-wh—Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Why can’t you get a girlfriend your own age?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s funny. Umm…. It’s not funny.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: I don’t like you going out with my daughter Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay. I can, I can see that. Umm, but I think if you give me umm, one chance I can, I can change your mind.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll give you one chance to change my mind. You got one minute.

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Daddy!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Fine! Two minutes. Go.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This is—you—

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: 1 minute 50 seconds.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, umm I want you to know that I have never done anything like this before. I mean, I mean I’ve been in um, relationships in general, uh but I have never done it with a student—I mean I not—not it! I mean, I mean I don’t—We haven’t done it. Uh, I mean, I mean, we’ve-we’ve-we’ve done stuff. Okay, okay, a joke, a joke—lighten the mood. Umm, two guys go into a bar. One of them is Irish.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: I’m Irish.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And the Irish guy wins the joke!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ross!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How crazy that we’d run into you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh God, thank you! Umm, uh, Mr. Stevens I’d like you to meet my friends uh, this is Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You’re Elizabeth’s father, huh? I can see now where she gets her rugged handsomeness.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Is-is-is there a-a Mrs. Stevens?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: There’s a Mr. Bing!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: No, unfortunately Lizzie’s mom passed away shortly after she was born. I raised her by myself.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe and Monica
utterance.content: Ohh!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: I get that a lot.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay umm, why don’t we all take a seat, y’know? And uh, and I’ll get us all some uh some coffees——Yeah, why don’t you. Uh and you guys can talk about whatever, whatever you want. Y’know? Whatever pops into your head.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y’know, it is so strange seeing Ross here this time of day, ‘cause usually he’s got the children’s hospital.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. Not looking for dates.

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: So uh, Monica is Ross’s sister.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And he’s a great brother!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: I had a sister.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohh!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: She passed away.

utterance.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Oh, you don’t have to do that every time.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: But uh Ross, Ross is a great guy! I was roommates with him in college. Uh, funny story… You’re roommate in college died didn’t he?

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: A part of him did yes.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay here we are Paul, Elizabeth. So I hope you guys were finding something to talk about.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, we were just…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi, I’m sorry I’m late but I am ready, ready to talk you up! When does Liz’s father get here?

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: I’m already here.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Ross is sooo great!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey honey, you got the kind with the little girl, you said we were gonna to get the kind with the baby.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, you said the baby creeps you out.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, the little girl creeps me out.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You said the baby.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why would the baby creep me out?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why would the little girl creep you out?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You guys, I’m sorry, could you please talk a little slower?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This is going in your book?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s about relationships. Y’know? The traps, the pitfalls, what not to do, keep going. This stuff is great!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?! Excuse me!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And how none of it matters when the people really love each other. And how people will believe anything you tell them as long as it’s a compliment.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh hi!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Hi! Hi. I think I left my keys here somewhere.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Well let’s look for them. Oh-oh-hey! Are these them?

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Oh, here they are right here.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh good.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Thanks for your help.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, wait! Sorry, Mr. Paul? Mr. Paul?

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Just call me Paul.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Paul. Umm, I just wanted you to know that Ross really is a great guy.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Well maybe you can date him then that would save me the trouble of killing him. Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You just don’t look old enough to have a twenty-year-old daughter.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Well, we were very young when we had her.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh. We?

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Well yeah, it usually, it takes two people to…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no! Yes! Of course, I know that! I just—I meant y’know are you still a ‘We’ or are you just ‘You?’

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: I’m just me, my wife died shortly after Lizzie was born.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh. So you raised her all on your own?

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Yes I did.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh. Ooh!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How was your first day?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pretty great! Except I did get a little attitude from the robot.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Damn those robots, they’re supposed to be our faithful servants!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Anyway, it wasn’t the robot, it was the guy who controls him. Yeah, he doesn’t like me. He had C.H.E.E.S.E. knock over the sandwich right when I was reaching for one! Ohh!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, why don’t you just get him fired?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I may have to, I hate to do it, but I’m the star! Y’know? There’s a limit to how many sandwiches I can eat off the floor. Excuse me. Joey Tribbiani.

utterance.speaker: Estelle
utterance.content: Joe! I’m glad I found ya, I got an audition for ya!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: Estelle
utterance.content: The thing is it’s kinda on the Q.T. The actor who has the part doesn’t know he might be fired. It’s the lead in a series, Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m the lead in Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.!!

utterance.speaker: Estelle
utterance.content: Uh-oh!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Joey?!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Hi Ross.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I was just getting him to like you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Joey?! Joey!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, Joey is not here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll just wait for him in here!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, it’s okay. You can come out.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Yeah Ross it’s okay, it’s me, Mr. Stevens.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh! Oh my God! I didn’t even see you!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Sure you did! You came in, you got all awkward, and you ran into the bedroom. You were shouting, "Joey! Joey!" Bye Rach.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Bye!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: I’ll call you later. Bye Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What-what-what the—how da-how did-what the-how did-what?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, y’know he lost his keys so he was looking for them…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: In your mouth?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! Downstairs! And we got to talking y’know, for like two hours, and I really liked him so I invited him up here for a cup of coffee.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You were at the coffeehouse!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, what’s the big deal? So I kissed the guy!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: He is my girlfriend’s father, okay? It’s-it’s, it’s weird!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wh—You dated my sister!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That was different!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? Why?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This is weird for me!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross look, look this is good for you. Okay? Let’s face it, so far the guy’s not lovin’ ya! But I can turn that around! I got the inside track! We can all go out to dinner, y’know? And I can talk you up! Ross, the guy is a very, very successful lawyer!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How is that important?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh it’s important!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Apparently, there’s like a million guys out there that can play Mac, and there’s only this one robot and this one guy who controls it! I didn’t know he could get me fired! What am I going to do?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well y’know Joey, you’re a pretty charming guy.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks, but I kinda have a problem to deal with here.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No sweetie, you’ve got to win over the guy that controls C.H.E.E.S.E.! You’ve got to kiss some serious robot ass!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s not a bad idea. Yeah. Okay, but if I got to turn on the charm tomorrow I’m not wasting anymore of it over here with you guys. Well, actually I got a little bit saved for you Pheebs.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So do you think uh, Joey’s more charming than me?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah! That’s why I’m sleeping with him on the side.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, you wish.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: "You wish."

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, stop writing about us!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m not writing about you! I’m writing about other people.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Marcia and Chester.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay fine! Fine! Then you know what, I’ll just write about Phyllis! Hmm!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phyllis is sitting in a chair.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I see what you’re doing!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phyllis sees what I’m doing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh-oh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, I have tasted my own medicine and it is bitter!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Morning! Hey, how’s my favorite genius and my little robot buddy?!

utterance.speaker: Wayne
utterance.content: Don’t touch him!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay! All right. Umm, all right Wayne, level with me. Okay? I-I keep hearing all these rumors that I might get fired. Okay, they even have actors coming in to read for my part! Come on man, you-you got to give me a second chance! I mean, I love-I love this little guy! Ah-ah!! Okay, that’s why you didn’t want me to touch him right? Here you go! Okay? Stupid! I can’t believe it! God! Hey, how you doin’?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So it seemed that my prom date had stood me up, so Ross selflessly, offered to take me.

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: What a nice story!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: So Ross was in college and decided to jump at the chance to take a young girl to her high school prom.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! I definitely did not see that one backfiring! I’m gonna go to the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, take your time.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Just-just so you know I was a freshman and she was a senior. So it wasn’t as bad as-as…

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Ross, look, I know I’ve been giving you a lot of jabs and it’s partly because I’m very protective of Lizzie, and partly because well, they just keep coming to me. But I have to admit that after all the wonderful things that Lizzie has told me and the many, many, many stories that Rachel has told me that, well you’re not all bad.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Not all bad.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: And anyhow, I’m sorry I was so harsh before, but you have to understand that I still look at Lizzie like she’s a twelve-year-old girl.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah. You know what? I know what you mean; I do that too.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: I beg your pardon?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! No! Not—I don’t mean I-I see her as a twelve-year-old girl! I mean I-I have a son, who’s umm six and I still think of him as a baby.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: You have a son?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, well my-my ex-wife and I share custody of Ben and umm, uh, and just so you know, Carol and I are on excellent terms as I’m sure you are with your wife! Oh, I’m sorry! It’s unbelievable!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Don’t worry about it, I just didn’t realize you were married.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh we were, but that was just a , I mean that was just a big drunken mistake.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You’re back.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: You two were married?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Whoops! I’m sorry, you were talking about Emily!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler, we said we would meet at the coffeehouse at six.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We said seven!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We said six!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The only way that I said six would be if the seven’s, let meet at seven, not at six.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah and if I had seven, maybe I would’ve said something like this, "Wow! My boyfriend’s such a wise ass—seven!"

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my good God.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ugh!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know what time you said.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well actually, I know what time Chester and Marcia said.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What time?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Quite an interesting turn of events, suddenly it’s my book to the rescue, huh? Ooh, very interesting. Yeah, well this certainly clears things up.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What does it say?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I will tell you as soon as you thank me for writing my book.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thank you for writing your book. Its-its uh, great book and you are the queen of everything.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thanks! So are you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I told you I should not wear this color.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Mon… Marcia and Chester are planning on seeing a movie on Sunday night. Marcia thinks they’re supposed to meet at six, Chester thinks it’s at seven.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So you knew we were gonna miss the movie!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s right.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Inside of telling us you decided to write in your stupid book!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Marcia and Chester are mad at Phyllis.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I can’t believe I’m going to lose this job!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh I’m so sorry man! Is there anything I can do?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! Help me get this mini-fridge past the security guard.

utterance.speaker: Wayne
utterance.content: Hey Joey, I want to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah? Well, I don’t want to talk to you Wayne! I hate you! You ruined my life! Oh, Chandler, Wayne. Wayne, Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi, how are ya?

utterance.speaker: Wayne
utterance.content: Joey, Joey, I-I-I’ll g-get you your job back if you help me out.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why should I help you?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The reason he just said.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What do you need?

utterance.speaker: Wayne
utterance.content: I-I-I saw you on stage talking to that beautiful woman, y’know Sarah?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Wayne
utterance.content: I wish I could talk to her.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What are you in love with her or something?

utterance.speaker: Wayne
utterance.content: Yeah. Her. All of them. Anyone.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve been there my friend.

utterance.speaker: Wayne
utterance.content: Listen, I-I guarantee you keep your job if you can teach me how to talk to women like you do.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh wow Wayne, it’s not really something you can teach y’know? It’s pretty much something you’re born with if you——You-you can teach it! I’ll show you right how to do it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I mean if you think about it, I mean Ross did learn something from each marriage.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: How to make the next one even shorter?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Now wait a minute that’s not fair. He was married to me a hell of a lot longer than he was married to Emily, he just didn’t tell me. Maybe I have to pee again.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Well, this is fun. So Ross, did you kill any of these wives?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know what? I-I-I… I-I have had enough of this! Y’know, I-I-I care a great deal about your daughter and I have treated her with nothing but respect! So if-if you’ve got a problem with me, frankly…

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Are you yelling at me?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: God no!

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Y’know what daddy? If you don’t like Ross, that’s fine. It doesn’t matter to me, I’m gonna go out with him anyway.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well if it doesn’t matter to her, it doesn’t matter to me! Still not yelling!

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Wow. What can I say? This doesn’t make me like you any better!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s okay, I’m not so crazy about myself right now either.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Then we agree?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh yeah, I guess—Yeah! I guess so.

utterance.speaker: Paul
utterance.content: Neither of us like Ross!

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: I like Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ohhh! Kids!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wait-wait-wait, I just thought of another story about how nice Ross is!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s okay Rach, we’re not liking Ross right now.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! I’ve got a lot of those too!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, it turns out you were right C.H.E.E.S.E.

utterance.speaker: C.H.E.E.S.E.
utterance.content: The shipment never made it through Omaha?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You got it! And the rabbi’s beard, 100% horsehair. Nice catch C.H.E.E.S.E.! It’s your line C.H.E.E.S.E.! Wayne! Wayne!!
